SEARCH
Package cz.cuni.mff.java.grapher

Class PaintedGraph

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.grapher.PaintedGraph
public class PaintedGraph extends Object
Represents a graph to be drawn and edited. Apart from the graph itself, this contains also all data necessary to draw, like positions and colors. Can draw itself on a Graphics instance. Allows to access nodes and edges at specific positions.

    • edges

      protected Set<Edge> edges
      Set of all the edges in the graph.

    • heldEdge

      protected PartialEdge heldEdge
      Currently held, incomplete edge. Only has a beginning node. Used for an edge which is mid-being added.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • loadFromFile

      public int loadFromFile(File inputFile)
      Loads the graph from a file. The expected format is an XML document with the a <root> element containing one <nodes> and one <edges> element, which contain any number of <node> and <edge> elements respectively. <node> specifies a node, containing <x>, <y>, <width>, <height> and <color> elements. <edge> specifies an edge, containing <start>, <end> and <color>. <start> and <end> are integers specifying the index of the starting resp. ending node of the edge by index in the nodes list <color> is a hex number preceded by # (e.g. #ffffff).
      Parameters:
      inputFile - file with the graph definition
      Returns:
      return code - 0 on success, 1 on failure

    • saveFile

      public int saveFile(File outputFile)
      Saves the graph to a file. The output format is an XML document with the a <root> element containing one <nodes> and one <edges> element, which contain any number of <node> and <edge> elements respectively. <node> specifies a node, containing <x>, <y>, <width>, <height> and <color> elements. <edge> specifies an edge, containing <start>, <end> and <color>. <start> and <end> are integers specifying the index of the starting resp. ending node of the edge by index in the nodes list <color> is a hex number preceded by # (e.g. #ffffff).
      Parameters:
      outputFile - file to which the graph will be saved
      Returns:
      return code - 0 on success, 1 on failure

    • drawSelf

      public void drawSelf(Graphics g)
      Draws the graph (i.e. invokes the drawSelf methods of all the containing edges, held edge if present and nodes).
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object to draw on

      Parameters:

    • getMinSize

      public Dimension getMinSize(Dimension limit)
      Returns the minimal size of a canvas the graph should be displayed on. This is defined as the smallest size that can fit the whole graph and is greater than or equal to the given limit. This method is useful for scroll behavior of a containing canvas.
      Parameters:
      limit - the lower limit on the minimal size
      Returns:
      minimal size

    • getNodeAt

      public Node getNodeAt(int x, int y)
      Fetches the top-most node which intersect the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      found node

    • getEdgeAt

      public Edge getEdgeAt(int x, int y)
      Fetches the top-most edge which intersect the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      found edge

    • setHeldEdge

      Set a new heldEdge.
      Parameters:

    • moveHeldEdgeEnd

      public void moveHeldEdgeEnd(int x, int y)
      Move the heldEdge to given coordinates.
      Parameters:

      y - y coordinate

    • dropHeldEdge

      public void dropHeldEdge()
      Drop the heldEdge.

    • finalizeHeldEdge

      public boolean finalizeHeldEdge()
      Convert the heldEdge to a full edge and add it (if possible). The end node is selected based on the PartialEdge end coordinates.
      Returns:
      true if successful, false if unsuccessful

    • hasHeldEdge

      public boolean hasHeldEdge()
      Does the graph have an active heldEdge?
      Returns:
      true if present, false if not
